title: Expansion of executive impacts separation  powers

content.question: The expansion of the executive branch since 1939 has affected the separation of powers by

choices.label: increasing presidential control over the legislative process
increasing the power of the media as a result of more frequent presidential press conferences
reducing the power of the Supreme Court through the use of executive orders
giving more power to interest groups than to parties
making senatorial approval of presidential appointees ceremonial

content.answer: increasing presidential control over the legislative process

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
